definition: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology
pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Ke1 ji4 Da4 xue2

definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: She was the soprano part leader in the University Choir, HKUSTSU.
sentences.chinese: 林氏曾为香港科技大学学生会合唱团女高音声部部长。

sentences.english: Vincent is now an MPhil student in HKUST's Biology Department.
sentences.chinese: 郑元山现在是香港科技大学生物系的哲学硕士研究生。

sentences.english: CHEUNG Wai Leung, Logan graduated from Physics Department of HKUST in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 张伟亮于2010年毕业于香港科技大学物理系。

sentences.english: University of Science and Technology. Taught at University of Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 于香港科技大学，曾任教于美国密执安大学。

sentences.english: I graduated my Master Degree in Electronics and Information Engineering in HKUST.
sentences.chinese: 我毕业于香港科技大学，是电子资讯工程系硕士。

sentences.english: David Zweig is a China expert at the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.
sentences.chinese: 大卫兹威格是香港科技大学的中国问题研究家。

sentences.english: He was conferred an honorary Doctor of Law by the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了香港科技大学名誉法律博士学位。
